title: Introduction to Law, Public Safety, Corrections and Security (2012)
subject: CTAE (2013-)

document.title: Law, Public Safety, Corrections and Security Cluster

D8B0876528414C378D03DAD039C7E295.description:
Create a personal leadership plan to participate in programs, conferences,
community service and competitive events on the local, state, and national level that
align with the competencies, skills and knowledge of this course.

B1DB0F93052948B4800AD7007A6C0A4E.description:
Explain how participation in SkillsUSA can promote lifelong responsibility for
community service and professional growth and development.

29AC21B02C3D40EE80A201DD2492894B.description:
Discuss the mission, purpose, motto, colors, official dress and other distinguishing
characteristics of SkillsUSA.

F5553978BB6D4387842E0C9758C1B1E3.description:
Explore how related student organizations are integral parts of career and technology
education courses through leadership development, school and community service
projects, entrepreneurship development, and competitive events.

41F7BDC099A04B95BA4C067B24326362.description: Describe the actions to take following a suspected terrorist incident.

90B55E3DC9FF409FB6981F831DBBE8DA.description:
Discuss the B-NICE indicators and the cues that help to identify when a terrorist
attack has occurred.

F11A3DF7AD2447DB9FBCF4D1EBEB2920.description: Identify the most commonly used terrorist weapons.

2B66EAEF23F74168A4D9B95F1BB6DFC2.description: Discuss operating procedures for a terrorist incident.

B7853A02E2B14E2489BFCE3F9F5E0D77.description: Identify common terrorist goals and potential targets in the community.

7C44F1B5A70E43F78C5DC7BA190DF243.description:
Examine common targets of terroristic attacks and the appropriate action following an
attack.

444C1770DEA54726A01B4D4DC2069F2A.description:
Describe the steps that rescuers can take to relieve personal stress and the stress of
disaster survivors.

5DA532638269498EA47AC3FCC1A2A8EB.description: Describe disaster and post-disaster emotional environment.

F2129D3B99D54F9D900780DD2A60B5CC.description: Evaluate techniques for managing intrapersonal reactions to crisis situations.

A3B10B9B772C4907B966783C80CF57A4.description:
Demonstrate proper intercommunication with both emergency dispatch (911) and
other rescuers.

F0A0B8EC054A48FE9DBFD62EDD84E1DC.description:
Understand the role that maps and Global Positioning Systems (GPS) play in search
and rescue operations.

737C32EC51D240A398213F030718CC11.description: Describe methods to protect rescuers during search and rescue operations.

0AEB648BDBC440A0B54E31C5DF3211F8.description:
Demonstrate the use of safe techniques for debris removal and victim extrication,
including but not limited to the use of fulcrums and leverage, cribbing techniques,
and victim transportation maneuvers.

855D86D536DF4FE2B21E528DF6E9A324.description: Distinguish between simple and complex access.

828034FECD7B48F09CB8DEB977424A32.description: Describe the most common techniques for searching a structure.

37386FE46B6841218892F9AB849B4299.description: Identify size-up requirements for potential search and rescue operations.

321EE63206CB498780A7241A1CA49767.description: Analyze the components of search and rescue operations.

C7E82616204147F1BBE2454363F7657C.description: Simulate how to extinguish small fires using an appropriate fire extinguisher.

D59C9008533441AB9CD5D8BBD348F616.description: Categorize the origins of fires and the different classes of fires.

16AD8CC936AE4E78BCE2599A678D0D76.description: Identify locations of hazardous materials in the home.

6A0D591AB364472EA15284190F429105.description: Describe minimum safety precautions, including safety equipment and utility control.

C887295AA3024EFDBC9A81F458182DFE.description: Conduct a basic size-up for a fire emergency.

51C06E9EC1A54E658A52AE74D2358F5C.description: Identify potential fire risks in the home, school and workplace.

D12068FAA769489CA14D6291573BDF49.description: Explain the role that LPSCS personnel and citizens play in fire safety.

28739CC55AB5465098DFF15F978032E8.description:
Describe the various origins of fires, classes of fires, and the correct means to extinguish
each type of fire.

254233A0C62E4B378987B60635A88D64.description: Identify laws that protect disaster workers from liability.

8285950C742544499B8E66D5ACCD4BD0.description: Describe the difference between evacuations versus sheltering in place.

7DCEE6D6ACD94A3CBB794BDB6E1CCF00.description:
Demonstrate preparing the home, school, workplace and community in advance to
minimize disaster repercussions, including but not limited to assembling a disaster
supply kit, developing a disaster plan, and designating a safe room.

B49A804DCDCB48169FE5A6BB4860241E.description: Evaluate the steps to reduce the risk of damage from hazards that threaten local areas.

B70EE3B71A17480CA1C7D7A3097CA1EE.description:
Identify potentially hazardous conditions on various types of structures and their
contents during a disaster.

789CFC6853E9481092062FE19A7A0006.description:
Analyze the potential effect of extreme emergencies and disasters on infrastructures,
including but not limited to transportation, electrical service, telephone
communication, fuel, food, water, shelter, and emergency services.

E3551170E4FF4721AEB073654BD905C8.description: Identify participants which make up the response workforce.

300094A10B124150ABAEC6DF30835954.description:
Identify the types of hazards likely to affect homes and communities and describe steps
to prepare for emergencies.

ABAD438883654B39A66DA99EFC5B69D4.description: Apply appropriate first aid and employ basic treatments.

A409DC6CD00D4EDF9E585FA8F2EACE97.description: Perform a simulated head to toe assessments.

913F7A08620446D2866EBAE89DC3FD6C.description: Identify sanitation measures to protect the public health.

8223E9DC396D4AAC803B9D622759F487.description: Conduct triage under simulated disaster conditions.

9B3B1FDFD31749FCBD0EEFC16CA3B993.description:
Apply techniques for opening an airway, control bleeding, hypothermia and treating
for shock.

FC5A33961CC04A65B6073BD9292E2540.description: Identify the “killers” (airway obstruction, bleeding, and shock)

D34C8AFF2BBD4FC2B600D65712E9E1EB.description:
Demonstrate the application, operation and maintenance of an automated external
defibrillator (simulate using trainer).

7C4EB791E5D543458C2A4B4E32AF1834.description: Identify when cardiopulmonary resuscitation may be discontinued.

A27986CA48BC4AF0BE108AC87A982D21.description:
Utilize personal protective devices and the use of standard precautions for disease
prevention.

44B80D21FEEE4F8C9E8D5FD40E41B2A2.description:
Utilize up to date American Heart Association, American Red Cross or other
nationally-recognized training agency standards to train in CPR, and first aid.

8989F37846704C53AF88CAB01686FC83.description:
Demonstrate cardiopulmonary resuscitation on an infant, a child, and an adult
(simulate using manikins).

6876A7FAB95B49919A90BC18C1FE7EF3.description: Demonstrate the steps of Basic Life Support (BLS) and First Aid.

611A0E722918434DA881EA26E5A31BEF.description: Identify hazardous materials and describe the methods for handling them.

E6C657EE694B492AA1A70E0205237374.description:
Utilize appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) and apply personal safety
procedures based on OSHA (Occupational Health and Safety Administration and the
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDCP).

3010F78319BD4EBFAEC0EDF2717C8974.description:
Differentiate between the basic responsibilities of each of the following in an
emergency/disaster situation: Citizens Emergency Response Team Member, Medical
Reserve Corps Representative, First Responders, and Emergency Medical Technicians.

DC5640B6AC7C42FF981304ED2E8DA19E.description: Explore the focus of the Citizens Corps.

CB259141BAF84E978A0A70D9DDCA7F93.description:
Discuss the history of the most common national, regional, state and local disaster
preparedness/emergency management agencies.

EAC4F24DD97049B79B77EF338A8568F6.description:
Discuss disaster preparedness/emergency management agencies, including but not
limited to: Department of Homeland Security, Federal Emergency Management Agency,
Citizens Corps, and Georgia Emergency Management Agency.

072E02C05D3641C381CBC983141C37A9.description: Identify the effects of corruption in LPSCS.

D203A2438E31472F86465C7650FAC720.description: Appraise the forms of misconduct other than corruption.

150CDA3E1C024115A60B1EC786FCDAF9.description: Explore reasons for corruption in LPSCS.

643688413A464A92B97D8FDB3E96F7BC.description: Discuss code of ethics for LPSCS employees.

DDB888C4855A4327BFE488CE62F66F5F.description: Identify unethical and illegal actions in LPSCS work.

D1A66EA38D52412F8CAA19C474105AFD.description: Investigate ethical and legal responsibilities associated with LPSCS professions.

F289CDDADEE54E9B8BD924E5EB9625AD.description: Determine methods to document critical information in response to LPSCS incidents.

4C114B0A698240A3B44760EA97138BE7.description: Write clear and concise narrative reports pertaining to LPSCS incidents.

837BA08F45C844FBAF0E0A24DAB1C960.description: Develop proficiency in interpreting verbal and non-verbal communication.

4E1EC87464A34902B52B995036718532.description: Apply active listening skills to obtain and clarify information.

1FBEE48357284F80A1DD856D54F3DA78.description: Demonstrate the ability to write comprehensive and accurate reports.

52B31494DDF543D290C04D615E52E2EA.description: Utilize field note-taking and report-writing skills to complete incident reports.

B2086A9718354EB89787FE30D180CECF.description: Demonstrate the ability to communicate clearly and professionally.

58489E50C8CF4262A8134EF2A93488A2.description: Demonstrate the ability to accurately complete various LPSCS reports and documents.

68165C1D08764C2B850A4D03F6769E2A.description: Explore case law pertaining to various LPSCS careers.

AF5A2442BC864120B1663CE87A0B7FDA.description:
Explore a range of constitutional and non-constitutional issues facing today’s LPSCS
personnel.

E0FD829B7B0146D3A70D0D76BE5EB774.description:
Explain the powers granted to LPSCS personnel and the restriction placed upon them
by the United States.

44AF2F3C165C45C9AF56996F1CFF9049.description:
Evaluate constitutional law as it affects LPSCS personnel and issues and incidents they
face in their careers.

8AFD1B97472D4283B5AC665F00CDC0D1.description:
Demonstrate a basic understanding of community outreach as it pertains to LPSCS
professions.

C626BF19A7494034A577D716E1930C09.description: Discuss the need for professional management and accountability.

F95FCF5B14CC4429A53037EAA61F81E9.description: Apply event management and crisis emergency protocols to a scenario.

CE77BADDEC67448CBDF1D09254524FDF.description: Demonstrate a basic understanding of the rank structure used in various LPSCS agencies.

469CDDF7D0DB48738C6B802239D529BE.description:
Discuss the core operational strategies of LPSCS agencies (Law Enforcement, Fire
Services, EMS, Corrections, Security and the courts).

DE34E5F34A214B7789885AF7A8F244DD.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the missions, strategies, policies and management styles
utilized by LPSCS agencies.

79BA6AF445034C3D81D014DF57973725.description: Explore the rights of citizens guaranteed by the United States.

32D1E88FA61942C4BDB495F87F577708.description: Differentiate between civil and criminal law.

6A19399B08884CABBB8AF6DA7AD7FD3E.description: Describe and apply knowledge of how the United States Legal System works.

DAFF03022E6840B1873AF9F36864377D.description:
Compare and contrast the roles and responsibilities of private security LPSCS agencies
and explain how they differ from public LPSCS agencies.

EF23B4B5A0E141F0860165E34A9EE448.description:
Identify jurisdictional and venue issues that may arise when different agencies work
together and provide suggestions for resolving those issues.

5855C8C0D0E74DD48750B28A26B01CC6.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of LPSCS processes and explain how different agencies work
together.

8532CF939DE4445DA1E3E7B86E8FCD1F.description:
Describe the structure and interaction between law and public safety agencies at a local,
state, and federal level.

161AE3CA76854404B9275018448EFAE7.description: Assess LPSCS scenarios and determine the best response.

FFCEED04295A4E228E2D7AF1402C5081.description: Demonstrate the ability to use critical thinking skills as the member of a team.

E29B75413537421AA8801FA01DDF700D.description: Identify a variety of mediation and conflict resolution skills.

4ED83AB888D04CD986CFAD0228C80068.description:
Utilize conflict resolution to effectively resolve issues in Law, Public Safety, Corrections
and Security.

32716976914E4FBC86DA9C22B648B3F1.description: Describe subcultures that LPSCS professionals interact with on a regular basis.

BA17CF374FCE4590AEB51D4E2956D3DF.description: Compare the cultures of major immigrant groups.

BCED2672E5E646588AEA66C6A3C38DB0.description: Explain the importance of sensitivity to situations involving cultural diversity.

CDB3442693814E9EA7F5DBD5C025A003.description:
Analyze how cultural differences impact the fields of Law, Public Safety, Corrections and
Security.

F3F1FDD57E1B45C595E81E19AB44F627.description: Explore the importance of health and physical fitness to LPSCS professions.

87811AC894EF4588B0D15921101C4F4C.description: Describe the steps that LPSCS personnel can take to relieve personal stress.

A16735D240D34B22BDD712C5BEB8F29D.description: Identify the sources and symptoms of stress for LPSCS personnel.

9575D2BC25174872B95632A717D8CD28.description: Explain how to maintain a safe work environment and minimize risk factors

E5B70D7787464119A29EE4EBACA7A744.description: Investigate personal career interests and develop a career plan.

71FE0C23B66E4E45B3E3A857D48576B9.description: Demonstrate ability to participate in a successful interview.

B0C9EEC3FB9446CC821EF51423359FC2.description: Create a portfolio for LPSCS career.

76D7DD4D305840AC810C41B6FE1A2D08.description: Demonstrate knowledge and skills required to seek, apply and accept employment.

957CB3AA2E6544FAA959BDF435A07F26.description: Demonstrate the ability to accurately complete a job application and resume.

46828DE8CF9E408E95442DB0A3CB0BD8.description: Identify character traits that should be present in LPSCS employees.

F8B377E8B726495F878283BE093CF9B5.description: Explore and evaluate careers in Law, Public Safety, Corrections and Security.

88B613E71ACE48BCB279FE0D4B1D5589.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

3F890419493B44288DEB7F7F9D858F1C.description:
Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace
to be able to work independently and apply team work skills.

891CA77BF8B24C56A3F8011B6B0C740E.description:
Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty,
accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

4E4F611587194D609E8E60251D2AF422.description:
Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in
career planning and employment situations.

24BA3637971C4C128EC03439AE863AE3.description:
Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and
methods.

A9232EF6A3224999B60E9553D02BE09D.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

B2419DE3FF8146E4AC33C6F805176602.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
